intro: Arracacia pennellii, commonly known as the Brazilian pepper tree, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and small, fragrant white flowers. The plant produces red, fleshy berries that are an important food source for birds and small mammals. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and ability to thrive in various soil conditions. However, it can become invasive in certain regions, posing a threat to native ecosystems.
